@luhx/global/Color.new.documentation:
* Returns a Color with the provided R, G, and B values
* Values are expected to be in the range 0 to 1

@luhx/global/Enum.CursorMode.documentation: * The appearance and behaviour of the mouse cursor

@luhx/global/Enum.Key.documentation: * Keys, which may be passed to `InputService:IsKeyPressed`

@luhx/global/Enum.MouseButton.documentation: * Mouse buttons, which may be passed to `InputService:IsMouseButtonPressed`

@luhx/global/EventSignal.documentation: * An Event that can be connected to

@luhx/global/GameObject.documentation:
* A Game Object
* Game Objects have a "base" API (properties, methods, and events) that can be extended by giving them Components
* The base API will be documented on the Component APIs page

@luhx/global/GameObject.new.documentation: * Creates a new GameObject with the provided Component

@luhx/global/GameObject.validcomponents.documentation: * A list of all valid component names which can be passed into `.new`

@luhx/global/Matrix.fromEulerAnglesXYZ.documentation: * Creates a Matrix which has been rotated by the given Euler angles (in radians) with the rotation order X-Y-Z

@luhx/global/Matrix.fromEulerAnglesYXZ.documentation: * Creates a Matrix which has been rotated by the given Euler angles (in radians) with the rotation order Y-X-Z

@luhx/global/Matrix.fromTranslation.documentation: * Creates a Matrix which has been translated to the given coordinates (specified as either a `vector` or the individual X, Y, and Z components)

@luhx/global/Matrix.identity.documentation: * An identity matrix, the same value as what gets returned with `.new()` with no arguments

@luhx/global/Matrix.lookAt.documentation: * Creates a Matrix at position `Eye` oriented such that the `.Forward` vector moves toward `Target`

@luhx/global/_VMNAME.documentation: * A non-unique identifier for the current Luau VM

@luhx/global/appendlog.documentation: * Same as `print`, but does not prefix the log message with `[INFO]`

@luhx/global/breakpoint.documentation: * Set a breakpoint at the given line

@luhx/global/conf.documentation: * Internal Engine configuration state, loaded from file (`phoenix.conf`) upon startup

@luhx/global/conf.get.documentation: * Read a specific value from the configuration

@luhx/global/conf.save.documentation: * Save the current state of the configuration to file (`phoenix.conf`), returning whether the file was successfully overwritten

@luhx/global/conf.set.documentation: * Change a specific value in the configuration

@luhx/global/defer.documentation: * Schedules the given function or coroutine to be resumed some number of seconds later, or as soon as possible

@luhx/global/fs.copy.documentation:
* Copies the file/directory at the given path to a new path
* Returns whether the operation was successful
* If unsuccessful, an error message is also returned

@luhx/global/fs.cwd.documentation: * Returns the Current Working Directory of the Engine

@luhx/global/fs.definealias.documentation: * Defines an alias for the filesystem, such that `@<Alias>/` refers to `<For>/` to the Engine

@luhx/global/fs.isdirectory.documentation: * Returns whether the specified Path refers to a directory

@luhx/global/fs.isfile.documentation: * Returns whether the specified Path refers to a file

@luhx/global/fs.listdir.documentation:
* Returns a table of all the entries in the specified directory
* The keys of the table is the path of the entry, while the values are the type of the entry
* `f` is file, `d` is directory, and `a` is all

@luhx/global/fs.makecwdaliasof.documentation: * Changes the meaning of non-qualified paths (e.g.: not beginning with `.` or `C:` etc) to act as aliases to the given path instead of referring to the CWD

@luhx/global/fs.mkdir.documentation:
* Creates a directory at the given path
* Returns whether a directory was actually created
* Will return false if the directory already exists, but the error message will be `nil`

@luhx/global/fs.promptopen.documentation:
* Prompts the player to select a file to open
* Returns the list of files the player selected, or an empty list if the player cancelled the dialog
* If the operation fails, returns `nil` instead

@luhx/global/fs.promptopenfolder.documentation:
* Prompts the user to select a folder
* Returns `nil` if no selection was made

@luhx/global/fs.promptsave.documentation:
* Prompts the player to select a path to save a file to
* Returns the path the player selected, or `nil` if they cancelled the dialog

@luhx/global/fs.read.documentation:
* Reads the file at the given address, and returns the contents
* If the file could not be read, returns `nil` and an error message

@luhx/global/fs.remove.documentation:
* Removes everything at the given path
* On success, returns the number of items removed
* On failure, returns `false` and an error message

@luhx/global/fs.rename.documentation: * Renames the file at the given `Path` to have the `NewName`

@luhx/global/fs.write.documentation:
* Overwrites/creates the file at `Path` with the provided `Contents`
* Returns whether the operation was successful
* If `CreateDirectories` is `true`, will automatically create missing intermediate directories to the file

@luhx/global/game.documentation: * The GameObject acting as the Data Model of the Engine

@luhx/global/imgui.begin.documentation:
* `ImGui::Begin`
* `WindowFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `nt` (no titlebar), `nr` (no resize), `nm` (no move), `nc` (no collapse), `ns` (no saved settings), `ni` (no interact), `h` (horizontal scrolling)

@luhx/global/imgui.beginchild.documentation:
* `ImGui::BeginChild`
* `ChildFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `b` (borders), `wp` (always use window padding), `rx` (resize X), `ry` (resize Y), `ax` (auto resize X), `ay` (auto resize Y), `f` (frame style)
* `WindowFlags` may be a combination of any of the following sequences, optionally separated by ' ' or '|' characters: `nt` (no titlebar), `nr` (no resize), `nm` (no move), `nc` (no collapse), `ns` (no saved settings), `ni` (no interact), `h` (horizontal scrolling)

@luhx/global/imgui.beginfullscreen.documentation: * Creates a Dear ImGui window which takes up the entire screen

@luhx/global/imgui.cursorposition.documentation:
* Returns the current position of the Dear ImGui element cursor within the current window
* To *set* the cursor position, use `.setcursorposition`

@luhx/global/imgui.endw.documentation: * `ImGui::End`, `endw` and not `end` because `end` is a Luau keyword

@luhx/global/imgui.pushstylecolor.documentation:
* `ImGui::PushStyleColor`
* `Color` is an array with 4 numbers representing R, G, B, and A

@luhx/global/imgui.setcursorposition.documentation: * Sets the position of the Dear ImGui element cursor within the current window

@luhx/global/imgui.setnextitemwidth.documentation:
* Sets the width of the next item
* `ImGui::SetNextItemWidth`

@luhx/global/imgui.setviewportdockspace.documentation: * Sets the region of the window in which Dear ImGui windows can be docked

@luhx/global/imgui.setviewportdockspaced.documentation: * Reverts the region of the window in which Dear ImGui windows can be docked to the default settings

@luhx/global/imgui.urllink.documentation:
* Similar to `imgui.textlink`, however, will open the given URL upon being clicked
* `Url` will be `Text` if not provided
* `ImGui::TextLinkOpenUrl`

@luhx/global/imgui.windowposition.documentation:
* Returns the position of the current Dear ImGui window (`ImGui::GetWindowPos`)
* To *set* the position of the window, use `.setnextwindowposition`

@luhx/global/imgui.windowsize.documentation: * Returns the size of the current window

@luhx/global/json.encode.documentation: * Encodes the provided value into a JSON string

@luhx/global/json.parse.documentation: * Decodes the JSON string and returns it as a value

@luhx/global/loadthread.documentation:
* Like `loadstring` in *other* runtimes, however does not compromise Global Import optimizations and returns a coroutine instead of a function
* If an error occurs, returns `nil` as the first value and the error message as the second value

@luhx/global/loadthreadfromfile.documentation: * Similar to `loadthread`, however loads from a file instead of from a string directly

@luhx/global/scene.load.documentation: * Loads `GameObject`s from the scene file at the provided path, returning a list of the root objects or `nil` and an error message upon failure

@luhx/global/scene.save.documentation: * Saves the list of `GameObject`s to the provided path, returning whether the operation succeeded

@luhx/global/script.documentation:
* The Script object the current coroutine is running as
* In `require`'d modules, this is `nil`

@luhx/global/sleep.documentation: * Yields the thread for the specified number of seconds

@luhx/globaltype/Animation.Looped.documentation: Whether the Animation should loop when it reaches the end

@luhx/globaltype/Animation.Ready.documentation: Whether the Animation can be played

@luhx/globaltype/Animation.Weight.documentation: The influence the Animation has over the rig

@luhx/globaltype/AssetService.GetMeshDat.documentation: Returns the provided mesh data associated with the provided path

@luhx/globaltype/AssetService.ImportMode.documentation: Imports the glTF 2.0 model at the provided path and returns it as a `Model` GameObject

@luhx/globaltype/AssetService.SaveMesh.documentation: Saves the mesh data at the provided path to a file

@luhx/globaltype/AssetService.SetMeshDat.documentation: Associates the provided mesh data with the provided path

@luhx/globaltype/Bone.IsActive.documentation: Whether or not the Bone Object is actively affecting a `Mesh`

@luhx/globaltype/Bone.SkeletalBoneId.documentation: The internal ID of the bone, valid range is 0-255

@luhx/globaltype/Bone.TargetMesh.documentation: The `Mesh` component containing Object the Bone is currently targeting. Note that this property is read-only, and will only either be equal to the Mesh that created the Bone, or `nil`

@luhx/globaltype/Camera.UseSimpleControl.documentation: Whether it is affected by the built-in controller (`W`/`A`/`S`/`D` horizontal movement, `Q`/`E` vertical, Mouse to look around)

@luhx/globaltype/DataModel.GetService.documentation: Gets the Object representing the specified Service. If it does not exist yet in the Data Model, it is created

@luhx/globaltype/DataModel.OnFrameBegin.documentation: Fires at the beginning of a frame, passing in the time elapsed since the last frame (delta time)

@luhx/globaltype/DataModel.Time.documentation: Number of seconds since the Engine started running

@luhx/globaltype/DirectionalLight.Direct.documentation: The direction light is emitted from

@luhx/globaltype/DirectionalLight.Shadow.documentation: How far back the shadow view is offset from the focus
The Far Z plane of the shadow view. Should be greater than `ShadowViewNearPlane`
Sets the focus of the shadow view to be the Scene Camera
The Near Z plane of the shadow view. Should be less than `ShadowViewFarPlane`. Shouldn't be `0`
Offset of the shadow view from the focus, after `ShadowViewDistance` is applied
Size of the shadow view. Sets `ShadowViewSizeH` and `ShadowViewSizeV` to the assigned value if they are equal. Is `-1` if they are not equal
Horizontal size of the shadow view
Vertical size of the shadow view
Whether the Light can render shadows

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.BindDataModel.documentation: Switches Data Models to the specified Object

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.CloseVM.documentation: Closes the specified Luau VM, releasing its resources

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.CommitHash.documentation: The Git commit that was used to produce this Engine build

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.CreateVM.documentation: Creates a new Luau VM with the given name. The `workspace` and `game` globals of the VM are taken from the currently-bound DataModel

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.DebugCollisionAa.documentation: Whether physics collision AABBs are rendered

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.DebugSpatialHeat.documentation: Whether Spatial Heat (spatial hash density) debug rendering is enabled

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.DebugWireframeRe.documentation: Whether the Wireframe rendering debug mode is enabled

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.Exit.documentation: Shuts down the Engine and exits the process with the specified Exit Code (or 0 by default)

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.FramerateCap.documentation: The maximum framerate the Engine will reach before attempting to self-limit

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.GetCliArguments.documentation: Returns the list of launch arguments given to the Engine. The first item is always a path to the Engine executable

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.GetCurrentVM.documentation: Returns the name of the currently-bound VM

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.GetExplorerSelec.documentation: Returns what is currently selected in the Explorer

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.GetToolNames.documentation: Returns a list of valid Engine tools

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.IsFullscreen.documentation: Whether the Window is currently fullscreened

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.IsHeadless.documentation: Whether the Engine is currently running in headless mode

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.IsToolEnabled.documentation: Returns whether the given tool is enabled

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.PhysicsTimescale.documentation: The current time-scale of the Physics engine (1.0 = 100%, normal speed)

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.ResetViewport.documentation: Resets the Engine's understanding of where the viewport is on screen back to the default (occupying the entire window)

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.RunInVM.documentation: Runs the given code in the specified VM. Returns `false` and an error message upon failure or if the code does not finish executing (yield or break)

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.SetCurrentVM.documentation: Binds the given VM as the "current" one. This causes all Scripts which load afterward to use the specified VM, it does *not* change the VM of any Scripts loaded beforehand

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.SetExplorerRoot.documentation: Changes the Root of the built-in Explorer's hierarchy view

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.SetExplorerSelec.documentation: Changes the built-in Explorer's Object selections to the specified Objects

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.SetViewport.documentation: Configures the Engine to act as through the Viewport is at the given position with the given size. Does *not* change where the viewport is actually rendered

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.ShowMessageBox.documentation: Shows a message box to the player with the given specification. The returned number with be the selected option: `0` for Cancel/No, `1` for Ok/Yes, `2` for No in `yesnocancel`. This isa blocking operation and no scripts or other parts of the Engine run until the message is dismissed. Avoid using quotes and backticks in the message

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.UnloadTexture.documentation: Removes the given texture from the Engine's cache, forcing it to be reloaded upon next use

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.Version.documentation: The version of the Engine build

@luhx/globaltype/Engine.WindowSize.documentation: The size of the window, in pixels

@luhx/globaltype/EventConnection.Connect.documentation: * Whether the Connection is connected or not

@luhx/globaltype/EventConnection.Disconn.documentation: * Disconnects the Connection, causing the callback to no longer be invoked. May only be called once

@luhx/globaltype/EventConnection.Signal.documentation: * The Event which `:Connect` was called upon to return this Connection

@luhx/globaltype/EventSignal.Connect.documentation: * Connect a callback to the Event

@luhx/globaltype/EventSignal.WaitUntil.documentation: * Yields the thread until the Event is fired

@luhx/globaltype/Example.EvenMoreSecretM.documentation: A secret message that's so, *so* secret that it cannot be read by Reflection-kun, almost like they're keeping a secret from her...

@luhx/globaltype/Example.GiveUp.documentation: Tells Engine-chan to kill herself and throws an exception

@luhx/globaltype/Example.Greet.documentation: Says hello to the given list of names. If the second argument is `true`, does so extra villainously

@luhx/globaltype/Example.OnGreeted.documentation: Fires when `:Greet` is called, and sends the response to the callback before the original caller of `:Greet` receives it

@luhx/globaltype/Example.SecretMessage.documentation: A secret message that's so important it's read-only

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.AddComponent.documentation: Adds the specified Component to the Object. Will error if it already has it (use `:HasComponent` to check beforehand)

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Destroy.documentation: Marks the Object as "pending for destruction". This may or may not remove the Object from memory immediately, depending on whether the Engine is keeping a internal reference to it

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Duplicate.documentation: Creates a duplicate of the Object

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Enabled.documentation: Whether the Engine updates and recognizes this Object, essentially freezing it if it is disabled

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Exists.documentation: Whether or not the Object still exists. Will be false after calling `:Destroy`

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.FindChild.documentation: Returns a child Object with the given name, or `nil` if one doesn't exist

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.FindChildWit.documentation: Returns a child Object which has the given component, or `nil` if one doesn't exist

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.ForEachChild.documentation: For all children of the Object, invokes the callback. If the callback explicitly returns `false`, iteration ends early. Callback cannot yield

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.ForEachDesce.documentation: For all descendants of the Object, invokes the callback. If the callback explicitly returns `false`, iteration ends early. Callback cannot yield

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.GetChildren.documentation: Returns a list of the Object's direct children

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.GetComponent.documentation: Returns a list of the names of all Components that the Object currently has

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.GetDescendan.documentation: Returns all descendants of the Object (i.e. its children, and their children, etc)

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.GetFullName.documentation: Returns the full, hierarchal path of the Object

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.HasComponent.documentation: Returns whether or not the Object has the given Component

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.MergeWith.documentation: Merges the Objects together, replacing descendants with the same name

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Name.documentation: The name of the Object, usually what was passed into `GameObject.new`

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.ObjectId.documentation: The ID of the Object, an integer. Remains the same throughout the session, but not guaranteed between sessions

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Parent.documentation: The hierarchal parent of the Object, or `nil` if it does not have one

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.RemoveCompon.documentation: Removes the specified Component from the Object. Will error if does not have it (use `:HasComponent` to check beforehand)

@luhx/globaltype/GameObject.Serializes.documentation: Whether or not the Object should be saved with the scene if it is serialized with `scene.save`, and whether `:Duplicate` will duplicate it (only applies to descendants)

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.ActionHi.documentation: The total number of Actions that have finished being recorded

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.CurrentA.documentation: The name of the Action currently being recorded, or `nil` if no recording is in progress

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.CurrentW.documentation: The ID of the Action that was last finished

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.DiscardC.documentation: Discards the Action currently being recorded

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.EnableRe.documentation: Enables the main functionality of this service

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.FinishCu.documentation: Finishes the Action that was last started. Only one Action may be active at a time

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.GetActio.documentation: Retrives information about a previously-recorded Action by its ID (IDs are in the range 0 <= ID < `ActionHistorySize`)

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.GetCurre.documentation: Retrieves information about the current Action being recorded

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.IsRecord.documentation: Whether an Action is currently being recorded by History

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.Redo.documentation: Forwards the state of the scene to how it was before the last Undo

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.TargetDa.documentation: The DataModel that History will track

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.TryBegin.documentation: Attempts to begin an "Action." May fail and return `false`. Only one Action may be active at a time

@luhx/globaltype/HistoryService.Undo.documentation: Reverses the state of the scene to how it was before the last Action began

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.CursorMode.documentation: The current mode/behaviour of the cursor. Refer to the `Enum.CursorMode` enumeration

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.GetCursorP.documentation: Returns the current position of the mouse cursor relative to the window as a `vector`

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.IsKeyPress.documentation: Returns whether the specified key (e.g. `Enum.Key.A`, `Enum.Key.One`) is currently being pressed

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.IsKeyboard.documentation: Whether the Engine is currently using keyboard input (such as for Dear ImGui). Do not process keyboard input if this is `true`

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.IsMouseBut.documentation: Returns whether the specified mouse button (`Enum.MouseButton.Left/Middle/Right`) is currently being pressed

@luhx/globaltype/InputService.IsMouseSun.documentation: Whether the Engine is currently using mouse input (such as for Dear ImGui). Do not process mouse input if this is `true`

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.ExtractAngles.documentation: * Extracts the orientation of the Matrix as euler angles in the YXZ rotation order

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Forward.documentation: * The forward vector of the Matrix

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Inverse.documentation: * Returns the inverse of the Matrix

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Lerp.documentation: * Linearly interpolates to the given Matrix

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Position.documentation: * The position of the Matrix in world-space

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Right.documentation: * The rightward vector of the Matrix

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.Up.documentation: * The upward vector of the Matrix

@luhx/globaltype/Matrix.__mul.documentation: * Two Matrices may be multiplied together with the `*` operator

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.Asset.documentation: The path to the underlying `.hxmesh` file, or a built-in identifier like `!Quad` or `!Cube`

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.CollisionFidelity.documentation: 0 - `Aabb`: An axis-aligned bounding box. 1 - `AabbStaticSize`: An AABB which keeps the same size as the Object

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.FaceCulling.documentation: An integer. `0` means no culling, `1` to cull its "back" faces, and `2` to cull its "front" faces

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.Friction.documentation: Fraction of Velocity it should lose per second while in contact with another object while `PhysicsDynamics` is `true`

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.Material.documentation: The name of the `.mtl` in the `resources/materials/` directory it should use

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.PhysicsCollisions.documentation: Whether other physics objects can collide with it

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.PhysicsDynamics.documentation: Whether the Physics Engine should apply forces to it

@luhx/globaltype/Mesh.Tint.documentation: The Color it should be tinted with

@luhx/globaltype/ParticleEmitter.Emittin.documentation: Whether the emitter should emit new particles

@luhx/globaltype/ParticleEmitter.Lifetim.documentation: The X and Y components act as a range of how long any particle can last, in seconds

@luhx/globaltype/ParticleEmitter.Particl.documentation: Whether the particles are attached to and move with the emitter

@luhx/globaltype/ParticleEmitter.Rate.documentation: An integer indicating how many particles should be emitted per second (must be above or equal to `0`)

@luhx/globaltype/PointLight.Range.documentation: How far light is emitted. If `>= 0`, the Range is used and attenuation is linear, otherwise it uses the formula `F = 1/D^2 * B` to mirror real-world attenuation, where `F` is the final brightness, `D` is the distance of a point from the Light, and `B` is the `Brightness` property's value

@luhx/globaltype/Script.Reload.documentation: Re-compiles the Source file and runs it from the beginning, returning whether the compilation and initial run were successful

@luhx/globaltype/Script.SourceFile.documentation: The File the Script is executing. Changing this to a valid File immediately reloads the Script if it is a descendant of the `DataModel` (i.e. `game`). To forcefully reload it, `:Reload` should be used

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.FinishedLoading.documentation: Whether the Sound has finished loading the `SoundFile`

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Length.documentation: The length of the sound in seconds

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.LoadSucceeded.documentation: Whether or not the sound loaded successfully

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Looped.documentation: Whether playback should loop once it reaches the end

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.OnLoaded.documentation: Fires when the Sound finishes loading, and whether it loaded successfully or not

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Play.documentation: Plays the Sound from the beginning

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Playing.documentation: Whether the Sound is currently playing (or requested to play, if `.Playing` is set to `true` by a `Script` before it has finished loading)

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Position.documentation: The time-position of playback in number of seconds from the beginning of the file

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.SoundFile.documentation: The sound file to be played

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Speed.documentation: The speed at which the sound plays, within the range of 0.01 to 100

@luhx/globaltype/Sound.Volume.documentation: The volume at which the sound plays. Must be positive

@luhx/globaltype/SpotLight.Angle.documentation: The Field-of-View (in radians) of light emission

@luhx/globaltype/Transform.LocalSize.documentation: The Object's scale factor, relative to it's parent Transform ancestor or the world origin

@luhx/globaltype/Transform.LocalTransfor.documentation: The Object's transformation, relative to it's parent Transform ancestor or the world origin

@luhx/globaltype/TreeLink.Scripting.documentation: Whether Scripts which descend from the `Target` will run

@luhx/globaltype/Workspace.GetObjectsInA.documentation: Get a list of Objects whose bounds are within the AABB

@luhx/globaltype/Workspace.SceneCamera.documentation: The `Camera` the Player sees the world through. If set to `nil`, a *fallback* is created at the origin

@luhx/globaltype/Workspace.ScreenPointTo.documentation: Converts the provided screen coordinates to a world-space direction. `Length` is optional and `1.0` by default
